intro: Cyphostemma cyphopetalum var. nodiglandulosum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange to red berries. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and medicinal properties.
